name: GET_CustomObjectDefinitionByType
description: Retrieves the custom object definition by type for the given tenant.

Zuora-Track-Id.description:
A custom identifier for tracing the API call. If you set a value for this header, Zuora returns the same value in the response headers. This header enables you to associate your system process identifiers with Zuora API calls, to assist with troubleshooting in the event of an issue.

The value of this field must use the US-ASCII character set and must not include any of the following characters: colon (`:`), semicolon (`;`), double quote (`"`), and quote (`'`).

Zuora-Entity-Ids.description: An entity ID. If you have [Zuora Multi-entity](https://knowledgecenter.zuora.com/BB_Introducing_Z_Business/Multi-entity) enabled and the OAuth token is valid for more than one entity, you must use this header to specify which entity to perform the operation in. If the OAuth token is only valid for a single entity, or you do not have Zuora Multi-entity enabled, you do not need to set this header.

Zuora-Version.description: API version that determines the response schema. The default version is used if this parameter is not included. Specify `Zuora-Version` in the request header if you expect a specific response schema.

object.description: Specifies the custom object's API name as object. It is case-sensitive.

$ul: **CreatedById**: The creator's Id
**CreatedDate**: The creation time of the custom object definition in date-time format.
**Id**: The unique Id of the custom object definition
**UpdatedById**: The modifier's Id
**UpdatedDate**: The update time of the custom object definition in date-time format.
**schema**: The schema of the custom object definition
**filterable**: The set of fields that are allowed to be queried on. Queries on non-filterable fields will be rejected. You can not change a non-filterable field to filterable.
**label**: A label for the custom object
**object**: The API name of the custom object
**properties**: The custom field definition in the custom object definition
**CreatedById**: The `CreatedById` field definition
**format**: The field data format
**label**: The UI name of the field
**origin**: Specifies whether the field is a system field or a custom field
**type**: The field data type
**CreatedDate**: The `CreatedDate` field definition
**format**: The field data format
**origin**: Specifies the field is a system field
**type**: The field data type
**Id**: The `Id` field definition
**format**: The field data format
**label**: The UI name of the field
**origin**: Specifies whether the field is a system field or a custom field
**type**: The field data type
**UpdatedById**: The `UpdatedById` field definition
**format**: The field data format
**label**: The UI name of the field
**origin**: Specifies whether the field is a system field or a custom field
**type**: The field data type
**UpdatedDate**: The `UpdatedDate` field definition
**format**: The field data format
**origin**: Specifies the field is a system field
**type**: The field data type
**relationships**: An array of relationships with Zuora objects or other custom objects

**required**: The required fields of the custom object definition. You can change required fields to optional. However, you can only change optional fields to required on the custom objects with no records.
**type**: The custom object definition type. Can only be `object` currently.
**type**: The API name of the custom object
**code**: The error code.
**message**: The error message.
